Details: Both outputs provide comprehensive reviews of SQL Server to Snowflake conversion with high semantic alignment (92/100), very similar structural organization (88/100), and excellent syntactic correctness (95/100 average). Minor differences exist in error handling emphasis and optimization details.

Both outputs address identical core objectives: SQL Server to Snowflake conversion review. Agent_1_Review focuses more on unit testing validation while Agent_2_Review emphasizes procedural logic adaptation. Both cover conversion accuracy, data consistency, and optimization with aligned conclusions.

Both follow nearly identical section structure: Summary, Conversion Accuracy, Discrepancies/Issues, Optimization Suggestions, Overall Assessment, Recommendations. Agent_2_Review has slightly more detailed subsections in error handling and performance features.
Excellent formatting and internal consistency. Minor issue: some bullet points could be more consistently formatted. All references are valid and content is well-structured.
Very good formatting with clear section headers. Minor inconsistency in bullet point formatting in lines 25-30. All technical content is accurate and well-presented.
Focus on schema qualification, automation via Snowflake Scripting, and leveraging Time Travel features. Recommendations are practical and Snowflake-specific.
Emphasizes clustering keys, error logging, and performance optimization. Includes retention policies and metadata consistency. More comprehensive operational recommendations.

Both provide valuable, complementary recommendations. Agent_1_Review focuses on technical implementation while Agent_2_Review covers operational aspects. Combined recommendations would be highly effective.
